name: Idiopathic Pulmonary Hemosiderosis with Secondary Capillaritis
chief_complaint: I keep coughing up blood and feel like I can't catch my breath, especially when I walk up stairs.
physical_findings: fine bilateral inspiratory crackles on lung auscultation
prognosis: Variable - depends on treatment response. Approximately 50% mortality within 5 years without treatment. With therapy, may achieve long-term remission but often requires lifelong immunosuppression.
description: A rare diffuse alveolar hemorrhage syndrome characterized by recurrent pulmonary hemorrhage leading to hemosiderin deposition in lungs, without evidence of vasculitis, infection, or other secondary causes. Pathogenesis involves autoimmune-mediated damage to pulmonary capillaries. Most common in children but can present in adults with more insidious course.
risk_factors: history of autoimmune disorders in patient or family
